definition: parent/one's own (flesh and blood)/relative/related/marriage/bride/close/intimate/in person/first-hand/in favor of/pro-/to kiss/(Internet slang) dear
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: If you would have a thing well done, you must do it yourself.
sentences.chinese: 如果要將事情做好，就得親自動手。

sentences.english: Traditional espresso machines require the operator to manually create the espresso.
sentences.chinese: 傳統的濃縮咖啡機需要操作者親自動手才能進行生產。

sentences.english: There are some people who believe that if you want something done right, you’d better do it yourself.
sentences.chinese: 有些人認爲想把事辦好就得親自動手。

sentences.english: The students do the work, but every move is monitored by a professor.
sentences.chinese: 學生們會親自動手，但每一個動作都由教授指導。

sentences.english: By using their own hands the professors have attained the objective of treatment.
sentences.chinese: 教授們親自動手，達到了治療的目的。

sentences.english: He is going to repair the machine by himself.
sentences.chinese: 他馬上就要親自動手修理機器了。
